column11: fit together, be in good terms
be friends; have an illicit relationship
spread on a surface, put tighly together
harvest (just the grain, not the stalk)
cluster together, wear one's hair in a bun
hold in one's fist, make a fist
coil around (a stick, tree), cut around (ridge)
become numb (due to lack of circulation)
help to walk from behing (a child)
